definition: lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: And caught on camera in the wild for the first time the elusive Borneo rhino.
sentences.chinese: 這是第一次在野外拍攝到神出鬼沒的婆羅州犀牛。

sentences.english: This guerrilla detachment which mysteriously appeared and disappeared kept the invaders constantly on the run.
sentences.chinese: 這支神出鬼沒的游擊隊搞得侵略者疲於奔命。

sentences.english: Elusive goal to steal notice, playing the police in their hands.
sentences.chinese: 神出鬼沒地盜取預告的目標，玩弄警察於掌中。

sentences.english: Appear and disappear mysteriously of an interlink killer, kill with extremely brutal gimmick female.
sentences.chinese: 一個連環殺手神出鬼沒，以極其殘酷的手法殺害女性。

definition: many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
